title: At the European Parliament, the French far right has deliberately done nothing
summary: For five years, almost all of the Rassemblement National's members of the European Parliament have shunned responsibilities. They are described as lacking the will and skills, but it is also a part of their political strategy.

title: China's Xi arrives in France for Macron talks on Ukraine
summary: Chinese President Xi Jinping has begun his carefully planned tour of Europe, where he will visit France, Serbia and Hungary to discuss Beijing's relations with Moscow.

title: Israel closes Kerem Shalom crossing after rocket fire as latest Cairo talks end
summary: Israel warned of a military operation in the 'near future' after it closed the aid crossing point following what it says was a Hamas attack.

title: Ukraine marks its third Easter at war under fire from Russian drones
summary: The shadow of Russia's invasion of Ukraine hung over the country as Volodymyr Zelensky marked the holiday, telling Ukrainians that God was their 'ally.'

title: Madonna puts on biggest-ever concert for free on Brazil's Copacabana beach
summary: An estimated 1.5 million people attended the last show of The Celebration Tour on Saturday, which kicked off in October 2023 in London.

title: Keeping the Olympic flame alive aboard the 'Belem'
summary: Three sailors take continuous turns on the French boat to ensure that the sacred fire, protected inside a lantern, is never extinguished, in accordance with the strict protocol.

title: Paris 2024: Students left unsure of their fate after agency requisitions accommodation for Olympic Games
summary: By mid-April only around 100 students had been rehoused out of over 1,400 applications.

title: Fashion finds firm footing in Marseille
summary: With a museum, a festival, schools and young designers, a wind of fashion has been blowing through Marseille for the past 10 years.

title: The complex issue of looted Chinese art restitution
summary: As Chinese President Xi Jinping visits France to mark 60 years of diplomatic relations between the two countries, Le Monde takes a look back at the fate of objects stolen from Beijing by French troops during the sack of the Summer Palace in 1860.

title: Israel orders Al Jazeera to close its Jerusalem office, seizes equipment
summary: Al Jazeera's office in Jerusalem was raided on Sunday after Benjamin Netanyahu's government voted to shut down its operations in the country.

title: England's Conservatives crushed by Labour in local elections
summary: Ahead of parliamentary elections due to take place before the end of 2024, the Tories lost almost 500 seats across England and Wales in a crushing defeat marking the return of Labour's popularity.

title: Israeli military accused of torturing Palestinian inmates
summary: At least 40 Palestinians from the enclave are reported to have died while in the custody of the Israeli army.

title: Russell 'Texas' Bentley: The life and death of an American from Donetsk
summary: Based in eastern Ukraine's Donbas region since 2014, 'Texas' committed himself body and soul to the pro-Russian side. He was likely killed by Russian soldiers who mistook him for a spy.

title: Palestinian doctor Ghassan Abu-Sittah denied entry into France
summary: Doctor Abu-Sittah, who worked for a month and a half in the Palestinian enclave at the start of the war, was turned away on arrival at Paris' Charles-de-Gaulle airport on Saturday.

title: France: Macron says a 'proportional aspect' in legislative elections 'would be good for democracy'
summary: In an interview with dailies 'La Provence' and 'La Tribune Dimanche' on French political institutions, the president said he thinks it's 'always better to leave the choice to voters.'

title: Biden in search of an elusive peace on US campuses and in Gaza
summary: Denounced by progressive youth for his policy of support for Israel and accused by the Republican right of allowing chaos in universities to flourish, the US president is in a delicate political situation.

title: 'Lord of the Rings' actor Bernard Hill dies aged 79
summary: Known for roles in 'Titanic' and 'The Lord of the Rings' trilogy, the actor's death on Sunday was confirmed by his agent.

title: Mona Lisa: Painting should be separated 'to save other works polluted by overtourism'
summary: The museum's management wants to isolate the 'Mona Lisa' in a room with its own entrance, which could help rid the painting of overtourism, says Michel Guerrin, editor-in-chief of Le Monde.
